CRIMINOLOGY  AND   
PENOLOGY  
 SALEM      
  
  
CRIMINOLOGY    
   a. very good passes in three (3) JUPEB/ ‘A’ level subjects:  
Economics and any two (2) of Accounting, Geography, 
Mathematics, Government, Physics, Chemistry and Biology. 
b. two (2) Cambridge 'A' level passes in Economics and 
any one (1) of the following: A ccounting, Geography, 
Mathematics, Government, Physics and Biology.  
(li) ABUJA accepts two (2) ‘A’ level passes in Economics and     
any of Science, Social Sciences, Management subjects or 
History/Government or NCE minimum ten (10) points or 
ND with upper credit in relevant programmes in addition 
to the UTME requirements.  
(lii) UNIKINGS accepts ND lower credit or NCE merit in relevant 
subjects.  
(liii) MCPHERSON accepts  
a. ND upper credit in relevant programmes.  
b. Foundation of professional examinations such 
as ICAN, ACCA, ICMA& CIBN.  
(liv) ODUDUWA accepts NCE merit in relevant subjects.  
(lv) CHRISTOPHER accepts two (2) 'A' level passes including 
Economics and any of Sciences, Social Sciences, 
Management subjects or History/Government. HND, ND or 
NCE credit in the relevant subjects.  
(lvi) ILORIN accepts ND in Administrative Management upper 
credit in addition to the UTME requirements.  
(lv) BELLS accepts two (2) 'A' level passes in any two (2) of  
Economics, Mathematics and Geography/Government  
              a. ND with minimum of upper credit in a related programme 
as the case may be from recognised institution.  
(lvi) FED-DUTSINMA accepts  
a) two (2) 'A' level passes in Economics and Social Science 
Subjects.  
b) two (2) 'A' level passes in Economics and Arts, Social 
Sciences or Mathematics.  
(lvii) PLASU accepts  
k) degree in any programme provided the candidate meets  
UTME requirements  
l) HND minimum of lower credit in relevant programme, with  
UTME requirements,  
m) ND lower credit in relevant programme, with UTME 
requirements.
